column9: Russia, Kazakhstan sign agreement on disputed crude oil linefill.
column10: OFFICIAL NEWSRussia, Kazakhstan sign agreement on disputed crude oil linefillCHELYABINSK. Nov 10 (Interfax) - Russia and Kazakhstan have resolved the issue of determining ownership rights to disputed crude oil linefill in pipelines in the two countries.Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak and Kazakh Energy Minister Kanat Bozumbayev have signed an agreement between their governments on determining the status of oil linefill in the Tuimazy-Omsk-Novosibirsk-2 (TON-2) and Omsk-Pavlodar trunk pipelines.After the collapse of the Soviet Union and distribution of oil pipelines as property according to the territorial principle, the issue of determining the ownership rights to 62,000 tonnes of crude on the books of Russian oil pipeline monopoly Transneft in the TON-2 pipeline in Kazakhstan and 141,700 tonnes on the books of KazTransOil in the Omsk-Pavlodar pipeline in Russia remained unresolved. The oil in both pipelines, previously the property of the Soviet Union, was put on the balance sheets of Transneft and KazTransOil, with the oil in the Russian section put on the books of the Kazakh company and vice versa.Under the agreement, the countries acknowledge that the oil in both pipelines is similar in quality and that the right of ownership to 62,000 tonnes and 79,700 tonnes in the Omsk-Pavlodar pipeline belongs, respectively, to Transneft and KazTransOil, and the rights to 62,000 tonnes in TON-2 belong to the Kazakh company.The countries are supposed to ensure that the 79,700 tonnes of oil that belongs to KazTransOil is moved from Russia to Kazakhstan along the Omsk-Pavlodar pipeline in several shipments within 10 months of the agreement going into effect.The recognition of Transneft's and KazTransOil's ownership rights to the crude for the purposes of taxation is not considered income when calculating profit tax in Russia or corporate income tax in Kazakhstan, and is not subject to other taxes.OFFICIAL NEWSKazMunaiGas plans to import 90,000 tonnes of dieselASTANA. Nov 7 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) â€“ National Company KazMunaiGas will import 90,000 tonnes of diesel to Kazakhstan to prevent the expected shortage of diesel due to the fact that less diesel will be produced at the Pavlodar refinery (Pavlodar Petrochemical Plant LLP), Chairman of the Management Board of NC KazMunaiGas Sauat Mynbayev said at a meeting in the Energy Ministry on Tuesday.In his words, currently there are 193,000 tonnes of diesel in stock at the beginning of NovemberEnergy Minister Kanat Bozumbayev, in turn, told journalists that in November Kazakhstan plans to import about 100,000 tonnes of AI-92 gasoline.But the output will increase in Kazakhstan, if last month the output was about 170,000 tonnes of gasoline then this month 250,000 tonnes will be produced, and accordingly, the imports share will be less, Bozumbayev said.There are three refineries in Kazakhstan: Atyrau (west Kazakhstan), Shymkent (south Kazakhstan) and Pavlodar (north Kazakhstan). They all are operated by JSC KazMunayGas â€“ Processing and Marketing, a subsidiary of Kazakhstanâ€™s National Company KazMunayGas.Last week Energy Minister Kanat Bozumbayev gave instructions to take urgent measures to ensure high-octane gasoline and diesel fuel supplies to the domestic market as soon as possible.The work is now behind the schedule. Initially, the completion dates of the modernization projects were set October 26 for the Pavlodar refinery and September 16 for the Atyrau refinery. However, KazMunayGas pushed these deadlines forward to the first half of December.At the time the minister instructed that the high-octane gasoline unit should be back to operation before November 8 and the diesel production units should be re-launched in the shortest possible time.If the completion schedule for the Pavlodar refinery modernization is not followed, Daniyar Tiesov, acting deputy president at KazMunaiGas and Shukhrat Danbai, general director of Pavlodar Petrochemical Plant LLP, will be dismissed, the energy ministry said in a press release.COMPANY NEWSTransneft, KazTransOil mull cooperation on pump equipmentCHELYABINSK. Nov 10 (Interfax) -Transneft (MOEX: TRNF) and Kazakhstan's KazTransOil have signed a memorandum on cooperation regarding supplies of equipment, the Russian oil pipeline monopoly said.The memorandum concerns cooperation on possible supplies of pumps, pump equipment, electric drives, sediment scouring equipment, electric engines and other equipment manufactured at Transneft plants and central maintenance centers to KazTransOil, Transneft said.The company Transneft Oil Pumps was set up in Chelyabinsk in December 2014. The company's shareholders are Transneft's Tyumen-based division Transneft Siberia with 51%, TM.P. S.p.A. Termomeccanica Pompe with 25% and Konar Invest with 24%.Investment in the project totaled 4.15 billion rubles. Transneft fully launched a plant built within the context of this joint venture in 2016. The plant has capacity to manufacture 160 horizontal pumps and 20 vertical pumps per year. The company is considering expanding production of pump equipment for other sectors of industry. The pumps cost 9 million-29 million rubles, which is 15%-20% less than imported counterparts, the company estimates.Transneft has also formed a joint venture with Konar Invest to manufacture electric engines for pump equipment in Chelyabinsk. Investment in this project has reached 9.6 billion rubles. Production is scheduled to start in January 2018. The new plant will have capacity to produce up to 300 units per year.COMPANY NEWSDirector of Pavlodar refinery dismissedASTANA. Nov 8 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) â€“ Shukhrat Danbai was relieved of his duties as general director of Pavlodar Petrochemical Plant LLP following the decision made by the board of directors of JSC KazMunayGas Processing Marketing, a subsidiary of National Company KazMunayGas (KMG).Ospanbek Alseitov was appointed acting general director of Pavlodar Petrochemical Plant LLP.Energy Minister Kanat Bozumbayev said last week that the top managers of the Pavlodar refinery would be fired if the modernization project was not completed by November 8.There are three refineries in Kazakhstan: Atyrau (west Kazakhstan), Shymkent (south Kazakhstan) and Pavlodar (north Kazakhstan). They all are operated by JSC KazMunayGas â€“ Processing and Marketing, a subsidiary of Kazakhstanâ€™s National Company KazMunayGas.COMPANY NEWSKazTransGas Aimak reports 25.7% increase in profit under IFRS in Jan-SeptALMATY. Nov 6 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) - In January-September 2017, JSC KazTransGas Aimak made a net profit of 11.06 billion tenge (334.10 tenge/$1) or 25.7% more than in the same period last year, according to the company financial statements under IFRS.In the reporting period, the company revenue rose 23.3% to 149.274 billion tenge year-on year, gross profit up 31% to 16.173 billion tenge, pre-tax profit and operating profit up 50% to 13.099 billion tenge and 16.985 billion tenge, respectively.In the first nine months of the year the company assets grew 7.4% to 313.670 billion tenge, equity up 26.3% to 157.888 billion tenge while liabilities fell 6.7% to 155.782 billion tenge.JSC KazTransGas Aimak, set up in 2002, is wholly owned by JSC KazTransGas (a subsidiary of National Oil and Gas Company KazMunaiGas) and specializes in gas transportation through gas distribution networks, in providing uninterrupted gas supplies for individual consumers, utilities and production enterprises as well as in the infrastructure management.COMPANY NEWSTengizchevroil boosted oil production 7% in Jan-SeptALMATY. Nov 6 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) - In January-September 2017, JV Tengizchevroil (TCO) produced 21.4 million tonnes of crude oil (171 million barrels) or an increase of 7% year-on-year compared to 20 million tonnes of crude (160 million barrels) extracted in the same period last year, the TCO press office said on Monday.In the reporting period Tengizchevroil sold 1 million tonnes of liquefied gas, 5.52 billion cubic meters of natural gas and 1.85 million tonnes of sulfur compared to 970,000 million tonnes of liquefied gas, 5.25 billion cubic meters of natural gas and 1.67 million tonnes of sulfur sold , respectively, in the same period last year, according to the press office.TCO develops the Tengiz and Korolyov oil and gas fields in Atyrau region.The joint venture is currently owned by U.S. Chevron (50%), ExxonMobil Kazakhstan Ventures Inc. (25%), Kazakhstan through the national company KazMunayGas (20%) and Russian-American JV LUKArco (5%). The company has been operating in Kazakhstan since 1993.Estimated oil in place in the Tengiz field is 3.2 billion metric tonnes (25.5 billion barrels) with 200 million metric tonnes (1.6 billion barrels) in the Korolev field. Total recoverable crude oil in the Tengiz and Korolev fields is estimated to be 890 million to 1.37 billion metric tonnes (7.1 to 10.9 billion barrels)COMPANY NEWSTengizchevroil boosted payments to Kazakhstan 70% to $5.9 bln in Jan-SeptALMATY. Nov 6 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) - In January-September 2017, JV Tengizchevroil (TCO) made direct payments worth $5.9 billion to Kazakhstan or 70% more compared to $3.5 billion in direct payments made in the same period in 2016.Tengizchevroilâ€™s direct payments to Kazakhstan totaled $123 billion from 1993 to September 30, 2017, including salaries to the local staff, goods and services purchased by TCO from local producers, payments to the state-owned companies, dividends paid to the Kazakh partner, as well as taxes and royalty paid to the national budget, according to the press office.In the reporting period, TCO purchased over $1.7 billion worth of locally made/provided goods and services or 30.8% more than in the same period last year. Since the start of the company operation in Kazakhstan in 1993 TCO has paid a total of $23.9 billion to local manufacturers and service providers.TCO develops the Tengiz and Korolyov oil and gas fields in Atyrau region.The joint venture is currently owned by U.S. Chevron (50%), ExxonMobil Kazakhstan Ventures Inc. (25%), Kazakhstan through the national company KazMunayGas (20%) and Russian-American JV LUKArco (5%).Estimated oil in place in the Tengiz field is 3.2 billion metric tonnes (25.5 billion barrels) with 200 million metric tonnes (1.6 billion barrels) in the Korolev field. Total recoverable crude oil in the Tengiz and Korolev fields is estimated to be 890 million to 1.37 billion metric tonnes (7.1 to 10.9 billion barrels).PIPELINES AND TRANSPORTATIONNord Stream 2 could go through intl waters if Danish approval not forthcoming; will take longer, be more expensive - CFOMILAN. Nov 8 (Interfax) - Nord Stream 2 is considering an alternative route for pipeline construction in the case that Denmark refuses to grant approval for the pipeline to pass through its waters, Nord Stream 2 AG CFO Paul Corcoran said at the European Autumn Gas Conference.He said that this option would take longer and be more expensive.In November, the Danish parliament will consider a law giving the government the right to forbid projects in Danish territorial waters in the case of a threat to national security. Nord Stream 2 could be affected by this law.In a conversation with journalists, Corcoran said that the alternative route for pipeline construction could go through Denmark's exclusive economic zone or in international waters, rather than territorial waters, using a more northerly route which presents several options for pipe laying. The possibility of building the pipeline via Polish territorial waters has been categorically ruled out. At the same time, he said that the company does not understand why Denmark is creating obstacles, "but we must be prepared for alternatives."Corcoran said that the law which may be adopted by Denmark, enabling the country to block the construction of the pipeline for security reasons, could be adopted at the second or third reading in November and come into effect from 2018. It would then be necessary to await the government's decision based on the new law.He expressed the opinion that the law would most likely be adopted.Corcoran said that under EU law the company has the right to build the pipeline. According to the current version of the law, which Denmark hopes to adopt, there will be no opportunity to appeal [the applicability of this law] and no transparency how decisions are made when applying the law."However, should this law be adopted, we must comply with it and must be ready for alternatives," the Nord Stream 2 executive said. Possible delays will depend on how long engineering work for the new route takes, although "the delay would possible be not so considerable."Receiving approvals for construction in Europe could take up to a year he said, but this doesn't mean that there will be the same delay for construction as it is possible to work in other areas.Corcoran did not say how much more expensive or longer the pipeline could be.PIPELINES AND TRANSPORTATIONTurkStream enters Turkish waters, quarter of offshore pipeline section now laidMOSCOW. Nov 7 (Interfax) - The first line of the TurkStream Offshore Gas Pipeline entered the Turkish Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) on November 4, the project operator said in a press release.Pioneering Spirit, world's largest pipelay and construction vessel, "marked the occasion by laying down on the seabed the section of the pipeline with Russian and Turkish flags, symbolizing the crossing of the EEZ border between the two countries," the company said.The border crossing also marks the completion of construction of the two offshore lines within the Russian EEZ. In total 448 kilometers of the pipeline were laid down, equally divided over the two lines. Construction of nearly 25% of the offshore pipeline section has been realized in less than six months, which is in line with the planned construction schedule. First gas is expected to flow through TurkStream in December 2019.After reaching the border of the EEZ with one line, Pioneering Spirit returned towards Anapa to commence deepwater pipelaying with the other line. Allseas' vessel Audacia had already finalized the shallow water section for both lines late July. Due to the chosen order of pipelaying it was possible to finalize the main offshore construction activities in the Russian EEZ in one campaign.Pioneering Spirit will now continue the pipelay activities with one pipeline all the way close to the Turkish landfall. The two TurkStream pipelines will come ashore in Turkey near the town of Kiyikoy, which is located approximately 100 kilometers west of Istanbul.The average speed of pipelaying by Pioneering Spirit is in excess of 4 kilometers per day, with a record set by the Allseas crew on November 1, 2017 by constructing 5.15 kilometers of TurkStream pipeline in one day. The water depth at the EEZ boundary is approximately 2,171 meters, which is close to the deepest part of the TurkStream route (2,198 meters).TurkStream consists of two offshore pipelines, both with capacity to transport up to 15.75 billion cubic meters of natural gas per year (31.5 bcm in total). The offshore section runs approximately 930 kilometers through the Black Sea, from the Russian city of Anapa to the Turkish town of Kiyikoy. Gas transported via the first pipeline is destined for the Turkish market. The other pipeline will be directed towards the Turkish-European border. The deepest point on the route of the TurkStream offshore pipeline is approximately 2,200 meters.PIPELINES AND TRANSPORTATIONRosneft planning to transship 36 mln tonnes of oil via Ust-Luga over 3 yearsMOSCOW. Nov 3 (Interfax) - China National Petroleum Company (CNPC) is ready to provide assistance to Turkmenistan in building the Turkmenistan-Afghanistan-Pakistan-India Gas Pipeline (TAPI) and the Trans-Caspian Gas Pipeline, CNPC International Turkmenistan chief Li Shuliang said at the Oil and Gas Turkmenistan-2017 conference in Ashgabat."We are ready to help Turkmenistan build the TAPI gas pipeline and to implement THE Trans-Caspian gas pipeline project," he said.China is a major importer of gas from Turkmenistan, having received a total of 184 billion cubic meters since the Turkmenistan-Uzbekistan-Kazakhstan-China pipeline entered service in late 2009.In turn, Turkmengas acting head Myrat Archayev said that three lines of the Turkmenistan-Uzbekistan-Kazakhstan-China gas pipeline were currently operating, enabling Turkmenistan to export 40 bcm a year to China.Completion of a planned fourth line will boost capacity in the pipeline to 65 bcm a year. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Italy is expecting to receive Azerbaijani gas via the Trans Adriatic Pipeline (TAP) in 2020, the Azerbaijani Energy Ministry said in a statement.Azerbaijan's Energy Minister Parviz Shakhbazov has discussed the progress of the TAP project with the Italian vice-president of Senate Linda Lanzillotta."During the meeting, the parties discussed the current progress of the project and the project's environmental impact. The construction of the TAP pipeline is 60% complete. Lanzillotta stressed that the Italian government is providing the project with the necessary support and expressed confidence that the pipeline in Italy will be to accept Azerbaijani gas in 2020," the statement said.During the meeting it was also stated that the future expansion of the Southern Gas Corridor would strengthen Italy's position. Nov 7 (Interfax) - Gazprom saw gas production increase 17.2% year-on-year in 10M 2017, Gazprom CEO Alexei Miller said during a meeting with Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev."Overall, taking into account growing demand in Russia and growing demand by our foreign consumers, we are going with year-on-year production growth of 56.4 bcm of gas. Without a doubt this is a significant increase," he said.Gazprom increased gas production by 5% to 44.7 billion cubic meters in October, data from Gazprom indicates.The Russian gas giant produced 384.1 bcm in the first ten months of 2017, 56.4 bcm or 17.2% more than in the same period of 2016. However, Europe and Gazprom are continuing to inject gas into underground gas storage plants in the EU due to the mild weather. Exports have remained at 192 bcm for the past 12 months, following 179.3 bcm.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSGazprom share on EU market continues to grow in 2017 - Gazprom Export CEOMILAN. Nov 8 (Interfax) - The share of Russian gas on the European Union gas market is continuing to grow in 2017, having increased to 33% in 2016 from 31% the year before.LLC Gazprom Export CEO Elena Burmistrova told Interfax in an interview that Russian gas exports are growing faster than the EU gas market."Throughout 2017, everyone could see how Gazprom's carefully calibrated strategy was working; ramping up volumes and maximizing forex revenues. We have implemented it successfully. I presented figures today [a forecast for an increase in gas exports to Europe to 185-190 billion cubic meters (bcm) in 2017 compared to 179.3 bcm delivered under Gazprom Export and Gazprom Schweiz contracts last year]. In other words, export growth is outstripping the growth of gas consumption in Europe. So we are seeing that the niche for our gas is being maintained and will remain open for a long time coming," she said.Commenting on speculation that Gazprom has the capability to influence prices by controlling export volumes, Burmistrova said: "In fact, we sometimes hear that Gazprom could play the role of price-setting supplier, that is to say, lowering volumes and thus artificially inflating prices. However, we are not manipulating the market. Firstly, we consider ourselves a responsible company and secondly, we are interested in increasing our share on the market. It will grow in addition to a proportional increase in gas demand. We are seeing the development of the gas market on the whole and hope to develop the NGV fuel market and the bunkering market, especially in the Baltic States. There are several of such niches which will drive gas exports".Buyers of Russian gas are taking advantage of the opportunity to boost gas offtake under long- and short-term contracts, and in these conditions new export auctions are not needed, Burmistrova said.Gazprom Export held its first export auction in 2015, for delivery during the 2015-2016 winter, and another in August-September 2016 for delivery between October 2016 and March this year. An auction for gas in 2017-2018 has not yet been announced."We've effectively decided against it for this winter," Burmistrova said."I'm not saying we've decided to dispense with auctions as a means of trading in the future, but right now we're having no problems selling gas. And we have enough orders from long-standing clients to supply more gas under our long-term contracts as well as more orders under short-term contracts. In other words, today we have no need for auctions as a means of stimulating higher sales," she said.U.S. LNGLiquefied natural gas exports from the United States to Europe would be competitive if the price of gas at America's Henry Hub is lowered at least two-thirds, Burmistrova told Interfax."We've seen various estimates and expert opinions, but it all comes down to the same thing. Don't be surprised, but for American LNG to be competitive in Europe, it would have to cost around $1/mbtu at the Henry Hub, preferably less," she said. Gas at the hub currently trades at $3.1/mbtu."But we understand perfectly well that the price won't fall so low in America. In fact, prices on the American market are tending to grow. In any event I think that to talk about it competing with Russian gas, which is incommensurably more appealing from the geographical point of view, would be premature today, even given that we are now seeing prices grow for oil, to which our contract prices are linked. Although the tendency for growth might be a temporary one, nobody knows," she said."Of course, for American producers in general it would be preferable to export gas to the Asia-Pacific region, to countries like China, or to new markets such as Indonesia," Burmistrova said.Asked about the prospects for competing with American LNG in China, Burmistrova said the "Chinese market is huge by definition.""And today we keep hearing new reports from China that the energy mix needs to change, that it's time to depart from coal. Of course, economically that would be fairly hard, in places painful for China. But the trend is quite obvious, and China will move assuredly towards this. So I don't think there's any point talking about competition on a market which is virtually bottomless today," she said.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSGazprom, IDRO studying possibility of cooperating on LNG, gas processing projects in IranMOSCOW. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Saudi Arabia's crown prince Mohammed bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud is satisfied with Russian cooperation under the OPEC+ deal, Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak told journalists."We discussed how the [OPEC+] deal was progressing and the crown prince was satisfied with the cooperation between Russia and Saudi Arabia aimed at balancing the market. "We will not discuss how advisable extending the deal is today. He did not rule out that a final decision could be made at a later date though.Novak said that Russia cut oil output by 315,000 barrels per day in October, exceeding its commitments in the deal with OPEC by 5%.The OPEC/non-OPEC deal, which entered force in January 2017, is currently set to expire at the end of March 2018. However, oil prices have risen steadily since late October, rising above $60 per barrel in the last days of the month.OPEC expects global oil exports to increase by 6.5 million barrels per day (bpd) to 44 million bpd from 2016-2040, OPEC said in its World Oil Outlook (WOO).Global growth of oil exports will be driven by expanding pipeline exports, primarily in North America, Russia and the Caspian basin.Oil exports from Russia and the Caspian basin will grow from 6.1 million bpd in 2016 to slightly below 7.5 million bpd in 2040. Oil exports to these regions will total 900,000 bpd by 2020.Oil output by non-OPEC countries will grow 5 million barrels per day to 62 million bpd by 2022, OPEC said.Non-OPEC supply growth will be driven mostly by higher U.S. shale production, and to a lesser extent by other countries.Russia is likely to produce 11 million bpd in 2017-2018, rising to 11.2 million bpd in 2019, 11.4 million bpd in 2020 and 11.3 million bpd in 2021-2022 before falling to 11.2 million bpd in 2025 and holding at 11.1 million bpd in 2030-2040.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSEnergy Ministry says situation with sulfur in Urals crude under controlMOSCOW. Nov 8 (Interfax) - The Russian Energy Ministry said it had the situation with the heightened sulfur content of Urals export crude under control."We've had this situation for about ten years. We've been monitoring it very closely for the last three years. We are responsible for the quality of the crude being supplied to Russian refineries, and we are responsible for quality and guaranteed exports," Deputy Energy Minister Kirill Molodtsov told Interfax."The situation is sustainable," he said.The Energy Ministry, concerned about the problem of the declining oil quality in the Transneft system in 2018, held a meeting on this issue at the end of October.A representative of one of the companies present at the meeting told Interfax that according to forecasts, sulfur content in the Druzhba pipeline, which delivers crude to European consumers, will be over 1.8%.According to information circulated to oil companies by Transneft, sulfur content could rise to 1.8% in oil shipped to Ust-Luga, to Novorossiysk - 1.58% and to Primorsk - 1.63% in 2018-2020.Quality is deteriorating because more Western Siberian low-sulfur oil is being shipped to China.Transneft planned by 2019 to have built the Nizhnevartovsk-Alexandrovka connector, which will allow high-sulfur crude to be exported eastwards. The sulfur content of crude pumped along the East Siberian - Pacific Ocean (ESPO) pipeline will as a result increase from 0.5% to 0.6%, but still below the 1% threshold. The sulfur content of crude must not exceed 0.65%, according to agreements with Chinese partners, but it could take a year and a half to implement these measures.The Energy Ministry proposed at the meeting to supply 4 million tonnes of high sulfur crude to Belarus by rail as a possible quick solution to the problem in 2018.Russia, Iran, Azerbaijan agree to broaden oil, gas cooperation, including field explorationRussian President Vladimir Putin, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani and Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev took part in a trilateral summit Russia-Iran-Azerbaijan in Tehran on Wednesday afternoon. The sides expressed their intention to deepen energy cooperation and synchronize power grids. The three leaders also called for determination of a legal status for the Caspian Sea. The three leaders issued a joint statement following the meeting.Putin last visited Iran in November 2015. The trilateral format last convened in Baku in fall 2016.The agreement on this summit's organization was reached in a phone conversation between Putin and Rouhani in late May, when the Russian leader called to congratulate his Iranian counterpart on re-election as president.Energy investmentsRussia, Iran, and Azerbaijan intend to deepen their cooperation through international energy platforms and in the oil and gas industry, according to a statement signed by presidents Vladimir Putin, Hassan Rouhani, and Ilham Aliyev after their summit in Tehran on Wednesday."The parties note the key role of the Russian Federation, the Republic of Azerbaijan, and the Islamic Republic of Iran in the steady functioning of regional and global energy markets, and favor broader cooperation in the oil-and-gas and petrochemical spheres, including on oil and gas field exploration and development, transportation and swap supplies of crude oil and petroleum products, and deeper coordination through international energy platforms," the statement said.The parties also called for a project to connect the three countries' power grids and for agreements on trade in electricity to be implemented.Moscow, Tehran, and Baku stressed the importance of joint efforts to increase trade and economic relations and noted the need to create a favorable climate for mutual investments, the document said.Further, the parties stressed the importance of strengthening relations between businesses, creating conditions in which their chambers of commerce and industry can work well, and advancing business interests.Rouhani said after the summit that the presidents of Iran, Russia, and Azerbaijan discussed possibilities for cooperating on hydrocarbon-production technology at the summit."We also talked about technical cooperation in the sphere of oil- and gas-acquisition equipment. And we also talked about investments in the energy sector, which play an important role for countries," the Iranian president said."Also, our power grids should be synchronized and connected to each other to make it possible to use each other's existing potential," he said.The project to build an energy bridge between Russia, Azerbaijan, and Iran, if implemented, would ensure the reliable supply of energy to the entire region, Putin said.The task of creating such a bridge is "still relevant," Putin said at the Russia-Iran-Azerbaijan summit in Tehran.The project involves merging the three countries' power grids, he said."Making this initiative a reality would increase energy security and ensure reliable energy supplies to the whole region," Putin said.He also said in a statement for the press that Russia confirms its readiness to supply gas via Azerbaijan to northern Iran."It is well-known that Russia, Iran and Azerbaijan are large hydrocarbon producers. But this does not mean that we should compete. This means that we should coordinate our efforts. By the way, the coordination within the OPEC framework has already yielded its positive results. But it would have been impossible, had the countries not affiliated with this cartel not joined this work," he said."The same is also happening within the framework of the Organization of Gas Producing Countries. Here we are also cooperating and will further cooperate. I would like to pay attention to the fact that despite the large-scale production of these hydrocarbons in each of our countries, there is, no matter how strange this sounds, an interest to supplies of these raw materials to each other. I refer to internal logistics. Well, for instance, we are reaffirming our readiness to supply gas via Azerbaijani pipeline transportation systems to northern Iran that can be economically feasible for our partners," Putin said.Baku, Moscow and Tehran played a big role in stabilizing oil prices on global markets, Aliyev said."Our cooperation in the oil and gas sector has history. This cooperation is natural because the three countries are contributing to the energy security of the world. At the same time, our countries played a very big role in stabilizing oil prices. Today we see that OPEC and non-OPEC countries are sincerely working with each other, and oil prices have now gone up to an acceptable level as a result of this cooperation," Aliyev said in a statement issued following the trilateral summit of the presidents of Azerbaijan, Russia, and Iran in Tehran.The trilateral format is very important for regional security, he said. "I believe that our successful cooperation plays a very important role in ensuring stability and security in the region. Of course, we are united by many economic infrastructure projects," he said."This cooperation format is very important and has a wonderful future," Aliyev said.Growing Azerbaijani-Iranian trade, which increased by 30% in January-September, and Azerbaijani-Russian trade (increased by 60% in January-September) shows that "our economy is developing successfully, and the sharp decrease in oil prices around the world did not have a serious effect on our economy," Aliyev said.Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said in an interview with Rossiya 24 on Thursday that Russia and Iran have signed a memorandum on cooperation in developing gas fields in southern Iran and gas deliveries to India via Pakistan."Cooperation between Russia and Iran is developing in the gas sphere, among other areas. One direction is Gazprom's participation in gasification of Iranian regions, in construction of underground gas storage facilities and in development of fields with possible gas supplies to third countries," he said."Yesterday a memorandum was signed aimed at cooperation in implementation of gas production projects in southern Iran and supplies of that resource to India through Pakistan's exclusive economic zone," Novak said."This is an infrastructure project that is currently being intensively studied; bilateral memorandums are being prepared. I think that it is entirely realistic for this to become a practical matter in the near future," Novak said.Caspian statusThe leaders of Iran, Russia and Azerbaijan have called for swift determination of a legal status for the Caspian Sea, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said."Our three countries are Caspian littoral states, and we talked about the legal status of the Caspian Sea being finalized as soon as possible so that we could use the existing potential of this sea," Rouhani told a press conference after the three leaders' meeting.Russian President Vladimir Putin said he expects all the agreements on the Caspian Sea status to be coordinated and signed in the near future."All of us [Russia, Iran, Azerbaijan] are Caspian littoral states. I hope that we will soon complete the coordination of all the parameters of our agreements, which should be signed on the Caspian problems, Caspian Sea status in the near future," Putin said following the talks.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSTatneft ups production 2.1% in 10MMOSCOW. Nov 8 (Interfax) - Tatneft produced 24.12 million tonnes of oil in January-October 2017, 2.1% more than in the same period last year, the company said in a press release.Of this, 23.8 million tonnes were produced in Tatarstan with 294,900 tonnes produced outside the Republic.Tatneft completed 645 wells in January-October, 20% more year-on-year, including 617 production wells.Taneco refined 7.11 million tonnes of oil in January-October 2017, producing 6.701 million tonnes of oil products (746,500 tonnes).Tatneft will hold an extraordinary general meeting on December 12 and one of the items on the agenda will be payment of interim dividends for the first nine months of 2017, the Russian oil company said in a statement.Tatneft's board recommended at a meeting on November 6 that shareholders approve a dividend of 27.78 rubles per share for all types of shares for the first nine months of 2017.The register of shareholders eligible to vote in the meeting will be closed as of November 17 and the date of record for dividends will be December 23.The company plans to pay shareholders 75% of net profit for the period, audited to Russian Accounting Standards, which rose 13% year-on-year to 86.2 billion rubles.When determining the amount of dividends for 9M 2017, the board relied on the company's operating results for the period, on the implementation of the Development Strategy until 2025 and on free cash flow projections. "Successful implementation of Strategy 2025 supports cash flow generation in excess of initial projections, procuring full financing of the company's investment program, meeting all its commitments, including social ones, satisfaction of the working capital requirements and high dividend income for shareholders," the company said.In April this year, when the board was making its recommendation for 2016 dividends, a new target level of dividend payments was set at 50% of net income under International Financial Reporting Standards, and the principle of distribution to shareholders of funds not employed in the development of Tatneft Group in accordance with its strategy was announced. "The surpassing of target level of dividend payments based on the results for the 9 months of 2017 was achieved owing to effective implementation of Strategy 2025, and the company's management will aim to maintain the same level of dividend payments for the full year," Tatneft said on November 7.Tatneft has 2,178,691,000 issued ordinary shares and 147,509 issued preferred shares par value 1 ruble each. JSC Svyazneftekhim, controlled by the government of Tatarstan, owns 29.3% of Tatneft's shares, partly via its Investneftekhim subsidiary.Shares in Tatneft hit new all-time highs on Tuesday morning on the news.Tatneft's ordinary shares were up 4.5% from previous closing to 457.3 rubles each by 10:22 a.m. on the Moscow Exchange, and preferred shares were up 3.6% at 335.6 rubles after rising as high as 345.4 rubles at one stage.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSEurasia Drilling boosts drilling, penetration 10% in 9MMOSCOW. Nov 8 (Interfax) - Eurasia Drilling Company (EDC) increased drilling 9.9% in January-September 2017 year-on-year to 1,247 oil and gas wells, the company said in materials.EDC drilled 933 wells in Russia, 74 wells more than in the same period last year.Penetration rose 10.4% to 4,193 kilometers in 9M of which 3,141 kilometers was in Russia.In September alone, EDC drilled 170 wells, up from 146 a year earlier. Penetration rose 16% to 531,971 meters.EDC drilled 118 wells in Russia in September, up from 111 wells last year with penetration up to 382,765 kilometers from 359,070 kilometers in 2016.Elsewhere, the board of directors of EDC's Russian subsidiary Burovaya Kompaniya Eurasia (BKE) has extended the membership of principle shareholder Alexander Dzhaparidze for another year.In addition, Dzhaparidze has been assigned the duties of chairman of the board, including organizing meetings and in absentia votes until a chairman is elected.The tenure of BKE board member Dmitry Timonin, who is also Vice President for legal matters at LLC Eurasia Management, was extended for a year.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSTurkmenistan to take part in OPEC+ meeting on cooperation in Vienna on Nov 30MOSCOW. Nov 4 (Interfax) - Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak, Uzbek Deputy Prime Minister Alisher Sultanov, Saudi Arabian Minister of Energy, Industry and Mineral Resources Khalid Al-Falih and Kazakh Energy Minister Kanat Bozumbayev have met in Tashkent to discuss the situation on the oil market.The parties addressed measures to restore a balance between the demand and the supply on the oil market in line with the Declaration of Cooperation that was signed between the OPEC member states and a number of non-OPEC producing countries, including three CIS members, i.e. Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan and Russia, and also Saudi Arabia, the Russian Energy Ministry said."The participating states welcomed a decline in the commercial crude stockpiles and declared their willingness to continue joint efforts in this direction," it said.Along with Uzbekistan, which hosted the meeting, the parties emphasized the importance of efforts to stabilize the market and ensure timely investments to maintain a sufficient oil supply in the future. They also mentioned positive effects of these processes on the global economy and international trade, the Russian ministry said."Vienna will host the next meeting on the Declaration of Cooperation on November 30, in which a fourth CIS country, Turkmenistan, will take part as an observer," it said.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSSOCAR drilling up 23% in January-OctoberBAKU. Nov 3 (Interfax) - The drilling divisions of State Oil Company of the Azerbaijani Republic (SOCAR) raised drilling volumes 22.6% in January-October 2017 to 114,909 meters, SOCAR told Interfax.Production drilling totaled 106,593 meters and exploration drilling - 8,316 meters.In October alone, drilling work amounted to 11,284 meters, of which 10,343 meters at production wells and 941 meters at exploration wells.SOCAR's drilling divisions commissioned 66 new wells in 10M, including 10 in October: two each at the Neft Daslari (Neftyanye Kamni), West Absheron and Pirallahi oil fields and one each at Garadag, Seadan, Darwin Bank and Bulla-Deniz.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSUkrtatnafta to fully switch to Azeri oil if rules of pricing for Ukrnafta products not changedKYIV. Nov 3 (Interfax) - Ukrtatnafta (Kremenchuk oil refinery) intends to completely abandon the processing of Ukrainian oil in favor of Azeri oil if the rules of pricing for Ukrnafta products remain unchanged, a letter dated November 1 reads."Ukrtatnafta plans in the near future to completely stop buying Ukrainian oil and switch to processing Azeri oil, if the situation with pricing for Ukrainian oil does not change," the letter from the head of Ukrtatnafta to the head of Ukrnafta states.The document says that, according to Kremenchuk oil refinery, the current starting price of Ukrainian oil at auctions is overstated."At the last auction, the starting price of Ukrainian oil was UAH 14,641 per tonne on the field, which is $62.5 per barrel, while Brent oil quotes were in the range of $56-58. Accordingly, Ukrtatnafta considers it economically inexpedient to buy Ukrainian oil, which was equated to the price of premium grade Azeri Light oil, the customs value of which al-so includes freight, transshipment, insurance, demurrage and terms of delivery to Odesa without prepayment," the company noted.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSBelneftekhim boosts exports 17% in Jan-SeptMINSK. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Belneftekhim exported product worth $5.6 billion in January-September 2017, 17.1% more than in the same period last year, the company said in a press release.Exports of chemical and petrochemical output rose 11.2%.The majority of organizations in the chemical sector saw significant growth in export sales owing to the measures undertaken to increase exports to high-margin markets, consolidation of the functions of commodity distribution network in the industry and stabilization of the Russian ruble. OJSC Polotsk-Steklovolokno boosted exports 11% in value terms, OJSC Mogilevkhimvolokno - 10.7%, OJSC Lakokraska - 22.3%, OJSC Svetlogorsk-Khimvolokno - 9.8% and OJSC Grodno-Azot - 7.5%.Belneftekhim enterprises produced output worth 13.17 billion Belarusian rubles, an 11.6% increase year-on-year. The industrial output index in constant prices was 95.5% compared with January-September 2016, reflecting the schedule for oil refining at Belarusian facilities.Production increased 11.6% for petroleum lubricants, 4.1% for Ai-95 gasoline, 17.6% for jet fuel, 24.9% for bitumens, 12.7% for NPK fertilizer, 3.7% for polymer-based paints and lacquers based on organic solvents, 12.4% for fiberglass fabric and 3.4% for bus and truck tires.Innovative production accounted for 47% for total output.Belneftekhim produced 1.236 million tonnes of oil in 9M 2017, 0.2% more than a year earlier.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSGazprombank, Uzbekneftegaz sign framework agreement on $500 mln loan for new refineryTASHKENT. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Gazprombank and JSC Uzbekneftegaz have signed a framework agreement on $500 million in financing for the investment project "construc-tion of a refinery complex in Jizzakh Region" in Uzbekistan, an Interfax correspondent reports.The document was signed during Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev's visit to Uz-bekistan.Uzbekneftegaz, the Russian Export Center Group and Gazprombank have also signed an agreement on organizing financing for "the production of synthetic liquid fuels from purified methane at Shurtan Gas Chemical Complex."In April, Uzbekistan started construction of a new refinery in Zafarobod District in Jizzakh Region. The plant has projected refining capacity of 5 million tonnes of oil per year and output of 3.7 tonnes of gasoline, over 700,000 tonnes of jet fuel and 300,000 tonnes of associated petrochemicals. The project will cost $2.2 billion. Construction is scheduled to be completed in 2022.Jizzakh Region is in central Uzbekistan, bordering Kazakhstan to the North, which will facilitate the construction of pipelines.Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan are planning to build the Shymkent-Jizzakh trunk pipeline be-tween the two countries by 2021 with a capacity of 5 million tonnes per year. Uzbekistan is interested in receiving 2 million tonnes per year of Kazakh oil to supply the Jizzakh re-finery.Uzbekistan currently has three operational oil refineries: Fergana, Alty-Aryk and Bukhara. The Fergana and Alty-Aryk fuel and lubricants plants have a capacity of 5.5 and 5.2 mil-lion tonnes of oil per year respectively. The Bukhara refinery produces high-quality gasoline, jet fuel and diesel. Installed refining capacity is 2.5 tonnes of gas condensate per year. Due to the shortage of feedstock, Uzbek refineries are not working at full capacity, partly with imported feedstock and under tolling agreements.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSLukoil completes construction of phase 1 of Kandym gas processing plant in UzbekistanTASHKENT. Nov 7 (Interfax) - Lukoil has completed construction of phase one of the Kandym gas processing plant (GPP) in Uzbekistan, JSC Uzbekneftegaz told Interfax."The first phase of Kandym GPP has been put into operation, designed for processing 4.05 billion cubic meters (bcm) of gas per year," the Interfax source said.Work was also completed on the construction of a field camp, a gathering system and ex-port gas pipeline as well as energy supply facilities and transport infrastructure.Construction is under way for phase 2 for a GPP of the same installed processing capacity of 4.05 bcm per year.According to the latest data, construction of the Kandym GPP is scheduled for completion in July 2018.The 8.1 bcm capacity per year Kandym GPP will process sulfurous gas from the Kandym group of fields in Bukhara Region to produce 7.819 bcm of treated natural gas, 134,360 tonnes of stable gas condensate and 212,900 tonnes of sulfur per year.In 2014 LLC Lukoil Uzbekistan Operating Company, a Lukoil Uzbekistan subsidiary and a consortium headed by Hyundai Engineering Co. Ltd signed a contract on delivering equipment and building the gas processing plant as well as the construction of production facilities at the Kandym group of gas fields on a turnkey basis worth $2.662 billion.Total investment in the project is estimated at over $3 billion.Lukoil has been implementing the Kandym project jointly with National Holding Company Uzbekneftegaz since 2004 as part of the Kandym-Khauzak-Shady-Kungrad production sharing agreement. The Kandym group comprises of six gas condensate fields: Kandym, Kuvachi-Alat, Akkum, Parsankul, Khodzhi, West Khodzhi. Production was launched at the Khauzak section in autumn 2007.Lukoil is also implementing the South-West Gissar project in Uzbekistan. A production sharing agreement was signed for the project in January 2007. In August 2017, Lukoil started gas production at Gassar at the target level of 5 bcm per year.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSNew petrochemical complex in Azerbaijan may earn $1.2 bln a yearBAKU. Nov 3 (Interfax) - SOCAR GPC, the planned gas processing and petrochemical complex in Azerbaijan, may have income amounting to $0.8 billion-$1.2 billion a year, SOCAR Polymer chief Farid Jafarov said."Annual income from SOCAR GPC operations is estimated at $0.8 billion-$1.2 billion a year. The overall cost of the complex construction project is estimated at $4.2 billion," Jafarov said at the SPE Caspian Technical Conference in Baku on Friday. The project is currently at the Front End Engineering Design (FEED) stage and negotiations on financing sources continue.SOCAR GPC will include a gas processing complex with capacity for about 10 billion cubic meters a year and a petrochemical complex with capacity to produce 600,000 tonnes of polyethylene and 130,000 tonnes of propylene.CIS, BALTIC and international NEWSSOCAR reduces oil product exports 29% in 10MBAKU. Nov 2 (Interfax) - State Oil Company of the Azerbaijani Republic (SOCAR) ex-ported 667,538 tonnes of petroleum products and petrochemicals in January-October 2017, SOCAR's press service told Interfax.SOCAR exported 945,148 tonnes of petroleum products in January-October 2016. In other words, the exports in 10M 2017 fell 29.4% year-on-year.The exports included 452,288 tonnes of diesel fuel, 43,110 tonnes of jet fuel, 236 tonnes of heating oil, 58,704 tonnes of high pressure polyethylene, 9,894 tonnes of isopropyl alcohol, 50,306 tonnes of liquid pyrolysis resin, 31,384 tonnes of propylene, and 21,616 tonnes of butylene-butadiene fraction.In October alone, SOCAR exported 69,336 tonnes of petroleum products including 51,129 tonnes of diesel fuel, 9,527 tonnes of jet fuel, 2,439 tonnes of high pressure poly-ethylene, 786 tonnes of isopropyl alcohol, 3,321 tonnes of liquid pyrolysis resin, and 2,134 tonnes of propylene.SOCAR exported 1,139,897 tonnes of petroleum products in 2016.Since January 1, 2015, Azerbaijan has just one oil refinery, the Baku Oil Refinery named after Heydar Aliyev.STATISTICSDeficit of Kazakhstanâ€™s current account narrows 16.4% in Jan-SeptALMATY. Nov 6 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) â€“ The current account deficit narrowed in January-September 2017 by 16.4% to $5 billion compared with the same period of the last year, the National Bank reported.Exports of goods in January-September 2017 grew 31.1% year over year to make $35.1 billion. The value of exported crude oil and gas condensate went up 36.6% and exports of ferrous and non-ferrous metals rose 59.1% and 20.9%, respectively.Imports of goods in the nine months of 2017 increased by 15.6% year over year to $23.1 billion and the trade balance surplus rose 77% to $12 billion.In January-September 2017, the negative balance of income from investment amounted to $12.3 billion tenge as payments to foreign director investors rose by 50%. Over 50% of this income was reinvested in Kazakhstan.In the first half of this year, the net capital inflow, excluding operations with the reserve assets of the National Bank, came to $6.6 billion, according to preliminary information.FDI net inflow stood at $3.3 billion tenge and portfolio investment net inflow at $8.4 as at October 1, 2017.The reserve assets, excluding the assets of the National Fund, were at $32.2 billion as at October 1, 2017 ($29.5 billion as at January 1, 2017), which is enough to finance Kazakh imports of goods and services for as long as 9.1 months.STATISTICSKazakhstan's gold and currency reserves down 1.4% in Oct, 3% in ten monthsASTANA. Nov 9 (Interfax-Kazakhstan) â€“ Kazakhstan's gold and foreign exchange reserves, including the National Bank's gross reserves and funds accumulated in the National Fund, decreased by 1.4% in October 2017 to $88.081 billion compared with the previous month and declined by 3% since December 2016, the National Bank says in a statement.The assets of the National Fund stood at $56.237 billion in October or down 1.5% from a month earlier and a decrease of 8% from the beginning of the year.In October 2017, gross international reserves of the National Bank declined 1.1% to $31.844 billion from the previous month and increased 7.8% from December 31, 2016.Net international reserves of the National Bank decreased in the reporting month by 1.1% from a month earlier to $31.328 billion and rose 8% from the beginning of the year.Assets in foreign currency went down 1.8% from a month earlier to $19.882 billion or down 0.2% from the beginning of the year; gold assets edged down 0.07% to $11.962 billion or a growth of 24.4% from December 31, 2016.STATISTICSRussian gas output up 10.7% to 565.499 bcm in 10MMOSCOW. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Gas production in Russia rose by 10.7% year-on-year to 565.499 billion cubic meters in the first ten months of 2017, the latest data from the Central Dispatching Department of the Fuel and Energy Complex (CDU TEK) show.It should be taken into account that there was one fewer day in February 2017 since 2016 was a leap year.Gas production in Russia in October was up by 2.1% year-on-year to 62.672 bcm.CDU TEK does not separately publish data on production by gas giant Gazprom. They are included as "estimated" figures in the entry "other resource users," which produced 423.809 bcm of gas in the ten months, including 48.103 bcm in October.Leading independent gas producer Novatek produced 38.214 bcm in the ten months, including 3.601 bcm in October. The operators of production sharing agreements produced 20.518 bcm and 2.189 bcm of gas respectively.The biggest gas producers among vertically integrated oil companies were Rosneft, which produced 39.408 bcm in the ten months and 4.139 bcm in October; Lukoil with respectively 17.542 bcm and 1.839 bcm; Surgutneftegas with 8.287 bcm and 0.837 bcm; and Gazprom Neft with 12.434 bcm and 1.421 bcm.STATISTICSRussian oil exports outside CIS up 2.5% in 10MMOSCOW. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Exports of Russian oil to countries outside the CIS grew 2.5% year-on-year to 200.543 million tonnes (4.835 million barrels per day) in the first ten months of 2017, the latest figures from the Central Dispatching Department of the Fuel and Energy Complex (CDU TEK) show.When analysing this information, it should be taken into account that there was one fewer day in February 2017 since 2016 was a leap year.Oil exports from Russia to outside the CIS in October 2017 fell by 0.7% year-on-year to 21.138 million tonnes, or 4.998 million barrels per day.Oil exports to outside the CIS through pipeline monopoly Transneft totaled 182.052 mil-lion tonnes (of which 165.933 million tonnes were Russian resources) in the first ten months, and 34.61 million tonnes bypassed Transneft. This included respectively 19.569 million tonnes (of which 17.727 million tonnes were Russian resources), and 3.41 million tonnes in October.Oil shipments through the Novorossiysk port via Transneft's pipeline system totaled 18.071 million tonnes in the first ten months, including 1.736 million tonnes in October. The figures were respectively 37.962 million and 3.896 million tonnes for the Primorsk port; 26.412 million and 2.903 million tonnes for Kozmino; and 19.986 million and 2.298 million tonnes for Ust-Luga.State oil major Rosneft exported 85.045 million tonnes of oil outside the CIS via Transneft in the first ten months, including 9.336 million tonnes in October; Surgutneftegas exported respectively 24.278 million and 2.608 million tonnes; Lukoil exported 17.821 million and 1.609 million tonnes; Gazprom Neft exported 8.817 million rubles and 1.09 million tonnes; Tatneft exported 12.295 million tonnes and 1.222 million tonnes; and Bashneft exported 239,300 tonnes and zero tonnes.Rosneft bought a 50.0755% stake in Bashneft in mid-October 2016, but CDU TEK statistics still count Bashneft's production data separately.Companies that are not part of vertically integrated oil companies exported 14.56 million tonnes of oil to countries outside the CIS through Transneft in the first ten months of 2017 and 1.486 million tonnes in October.Transit shipments totaled 13.524 million tonnes in the first ten months and 1.618 million tonnes in October for Kazakhstan; respectively 1.243 million tonnes and 85,000 tonnes for Azerbaijan; and 1.352 million tonnes and 138,600 tonnes for Belarus.Russian crude exports to countries in the CIS fell by 7.5% to 14.896 million tonnes in the first ten months of 2017. Crude is only exported to Belarus.STATISTICSUkraine cuts gas consumption by 4% in 10MKYIV. Nov 2 (Interfax) - Ukraine in January-October 2017 reduced natural gas consumption (excluding production and technological costs) by 4% compared to the same period last year, to 21.1 billion cubic meters, the press service of PJSC Ukrtransgaz has reported.According to its data, a 10% drop in consumption for the ten months along with a 0.5% reduction in consumption in the nine months is mainly due to relatively high temperatures in October.Ukraine in 2016 reduced consumption of natural gas by 4.1% (by 1.366 billion cubic meters) compared to 2015, to 32.361 billion cubic meters. In particular, industry consumed 9.599 billion cubic meters (15.9% down from 2015), the population and budget organizations some 12.457 billion cubic meters (2.3% up), and heating companies 7.034 billion cubic meters (1.4% up), while production and technological expenses amounted to 3.271 billion cubic meters (2.4% up).ImportsUkraine in January-October this year increased natural gas imports by 49.6% (by 3.906 billion cubic meters) compared to the same period in 2016, to 11.778 billion cubic meters, according to data from PJSC Ukrtransgaz.According to calculations made by Interfax-Ukraine, in particular Ukraine in January-October 2017 imported 8.45 billion cubic meters of gas from Slovakia, 2.316 billion cubic meters from Hungary, and 1.012 billion cubic meters from Poland.In October 2017 imports amounted to 1.073 billion cubic meters of gas, which is 30.5% less than in October 2016.Ukraine has not been importing natural gas under the contract with Gazprom since November 26, 2015, purchasing it exclusively on its western border.Ukraine in 2016 reduced imports of natural gas by 32.7% (by 5.376 billion cubic meters) compared to 2015, to 11.078 billion cubic meters.Ukrtransgaz, 100% owned by Naftogaz Ukrainy, operates a system of trunk gas pipelines and 12 underground gas storage facilities in the country.TransitUkraine in January-October 2017 increased natural gas transit through the gas transportation system (GTS) of Ukraine by 18.5% or 12.078 billion cubic meters (bcm) year-over-year, to 77.37 bcm, according to Ukrtransgaz.Transit of natural gas to the EU countries across Ukraine totaled 75.313 bcm in January-October 2017, and to Moldova - 2.057 bcm.In October alone, gas transit fell by 15.3% or 1.263 bcm year-over-year, to 7.013 bcm. Transit to Europe last month totaled 6.772 bcm and to Moldova - 241.7 million cubic me-ters.Ukraine in 2016 increased transit of natural gas through its gas transportation system by 22.5% compared with 2015, to 82.2 bcm.Ukrtransgaz, fully owned by Naftogaz Ukrainy, operates a system of trunk gas pipelines and 12 underground gas storage facilities in the country.STATISTICSAzerbaijan increases daily oil production to 800,000 barrels in Oct, complying with OPEC+ agreementBAKU. Nov 8 (Interfax) - Daily oil production in Azerbaijan was 800,600 barrels in October 2017, the Azerbaijani Energy Ministry said.This included 746,800 barrels of oil and 53,800 barrels of condensate.Azerbaijan pledged under the agreement between OPEC and non-OPEC countries to cut its oil production by 35,000 barrels per day to less than 800,000 barrels.In January 2017, daily oil production in Azerbaijan was 793,900 barrels, in February - 776,400 barrels, in March - 733,300 barrels, in April - 781,100 barrels, in May - 785,300 barrels, in June - 793,700 barrels, July - 796,700 barrels, August - 734,800 barrels and September - 785,700 barrels."Thus Azerbaijan has honored its commitments to cut oil production in January-October 2017," the Energy Ministry said.According to the Energy Ministry data, in October this year, daily oil exports from Azerbaijan stood at 628,000 barrels, condensate - 53,800 barrels and petroleum products - 24,300 barrels.* * * * *Copyright (c) 2017 Interfax-Kazakhstan. column5: Beijing, September 22 (QNA) -Crudeoiloutput in China reached 18.3 million tonnes in August, a year on year increase of 4.9 percent, data from the top economic planner showed.
column9: China Crude Oil Output Rises 4.9% in August
column10: Beijing, September 22 (QNA) - Crude oil output in China reached 18.3 million tonnes in August, a year on year increase of 4.9 percent, data from the top economic planner showed.China refined 40.37 million tonnes of crude oil during the period, up 2.8 percent year on year, while refined oil production rose 3.7 percent to 25.15 million tonnes, the National Development and Reform Commission said in an online statement.Apparent consumption of refined oil, calculated as production plus imports minus exports, increased 2.2 percent from a year earlier to 24.52 million tonnes, according to China's (Xinhua) News Agency.In a separate statement, the planner said natural gas output totaled 10.6 billion cubic meters last month, up 3.8 percent year on year.Imports of natural gas saw an increase of 1.4 percent to 4.7 billion cubic meters, while apparent consumption came in at 14.1 billion cubic meters, the commission said.China's appetite for energy has grown substantially amid rapid industrialization and urbanization. (QNA)SHM,LYQNA 0507 GMT 2015/09/22Copyright 2015 by Qatar News Agency Distributed by UPICopyright of Arabia 2000 is the property of Arabia 2000. column5: Despite opposition from environmentalists, somewhat stagnated growth, and cancellation of a major petrochemical project, Taiwan’s petrochemical industry is currently experiencing rapidly increasing profits. Infiniti Research expects this trend to continue and the outlook for this industry to be positive over the near future, and predicts that Taiwan will remain one of the world’s largest producers of petrochemicals.   [ABSTRACT FROM PUBLISHER]
column9: Infiniti Research: Low Price of Crude Oil Staving off Petrochemical Industry Decline in Taiwan
column10: Despite opposition from environmentalists, somewhat stagnated growth, and cancellation of a major petrochemical project, Taiwan’s petrochemical industry is currently experiencing rapidly increasing profits. Infiniti Research expects this trend to continue and the outlook for this industry to be positive over the near future, and predicts that Taiwan will remain one of the world’s largest producers of petrochemicals.  This Smart News Release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20170509006149/en/ Infiniti Research offers a variety of chemical market intelligence solutions. (Graphic: Business Wire)   Market Insights   Taiwan’s petrochemical industry primarily produces commodity chemicals, especially polypropylene and other plastic resins. Despite constraints on the supply of raw materials and an increased reliance on imports for certain chemicals and materials, profits and profit margins in the industry are increasing substantially. This is largely due to oversupply in the global crude oil markets, which is resulting in lower prices of crude oil (in the range of USD 50-55 bbl). As crude oil comprises almost 80% of costs for upstream petrochemical manufacturers, operating costs are falling in line with crude oil prices.   These increased profits are helping Taiwan’s petrochemical manufacturers to thrive despite the presence of many obstacles, including the cancellation of the Kuokuang petrochemical complex project in 2011, which eliminated the potential for many jobs and the opportunity for increased production throughout the industry. Additionally, new environmental regulations and protections were expected to have a negative effect on the production and revenues of petrochemical manufacturers in Taiwan. While total revenues in the industry have dropped slightly as of late, crude oil oversupply is so far allowing the industry to increase profits and remain afloat.   Looking for more research on the petrochemical industry? Request a free proposal   Market Opportunities   The changing circumstances and potential sensitivity of this industry can make it difficult for vendors and competitors to gain a full and accurate picture of how it will perform over the long term. Market intelligence is essential to understand opportunities, challenges, and trends in Taiwan’s petrochemical industry and how its performance will affect the global petrochemical industry as a whole. It can provide insights on factors that are essential for understanding the market potential, including government regulations, environmental standards, and fluctuating raw material prices.   Infiniti Research was recently approached by a leading chemicals manufacturer who wanted to identify and profile key prospects for its products in the European market. The insights and solutions provided by Infiniti’s chemical industry analysts allowed the client to streamline its sales efforts, identify key competitors, and gain a holistic understanding of purchase drivers, criteria, and challenges.   Request a brochure and see how you can benefit from Infiniti’s services   About Infiniti Research   Established in 2003, Infiniti Research is a leading market intelligence company providing smart solutions to address your business challenges. Infiniti Research studies markets in more than 100 countries to help analyze competitive activity, see beyond market disruptions, and develop intelligent business strategies.   With 13 years of experience and offices across three continents, Infiniti Research has been instrumental in providing a complete range of competitive intelligence, strategy, and research services for over 550 companies across the globe. column5: Research and Markets has announced the addition of the "Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Market 2014 - 2025" report to their offering.   [ABSTRACT FROM PUBLISHER]
column9: Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Market to Reach $8.6 Billion by 2025 - Owing to Rising Crude Oil Demand & Number of Mature Wells - Research and Markets
column10: Research and Markets has announced the addition of the "Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Market 2014 - 2025" report to their offering.   The global carbon dioxide market size is expected to reach USD 8.6 billion by 2025. Increasing applications of enhanced oil recovery (EOR) technology, owing to rising crude oil demand and number of mature wells is anticipated to fuel the market growth over the next nine years.   Carbon dioxide is a high profile greenhouse gas. However, the excessive amount of CO2 is being dumped into the atmosphere from past few years due to the growth in industrialization. This has resulted in global warming, suffocation of living organisms, and various other health related problems which becomes toxic and harmful to humans.   Companies are also developing advanced carbon capturing and storage technologies such as CCS for effectively capturing, purifying, liquefying, and storing CO2. These companies are also involved in developing effective systems for transporting CO2, which include pipelines, ships, rail, and road tankers. Oil and gas is the major application segment for carbon dioxide market from past few years.   Growing demand for crude oil and advancement in the EOR technologies are the major factor fueling the growth in this segment. In 2015, oil & gas application was followed by food & beverages sector in terms of growth. Increasing demand for carbonation of beverages is anticipated to drive the growth of food & beverages market segment.   Companies Mentioned  Universal Industrial Gases, Inc. Linde AG Air Products and Chemicals, Inc. INOX Air Products Ltd. Airgas, Inc. Continental Carbonic Products, Inc. Praxair, Inc. Matheson Tri-Gas, Inc. The BOC Group AGA AB Air Liquide Cosmo Engineering Co. Ltd. column5: Headline of release should read: MonarchOilPipeline, LLC Launches Non-Binding Open Season for NewCrudeOilPipeline (instead of MonarchOilPipeline, LLC Launches Binding Open Season for NewCrudeOilPipeline). column9: CORRECTING and REPLACING Monarch Oil Pipeline, LLC Launches Non-Binding Open Season for New Crude Oil Pipeline
column10: Headline of release should read: Monarch Oil Pipeline, LLC Launches Non-Binding Open Season for New Crude Oil Pipeline (instead of Monarch Oil Pipeline, LLC Launches Binding Open Season for New Crude Oil Pipeline). Fifth paragraph of release should read: ...non-binding Open Season... (instead of ...binding Open Season...).   The corrected release reads:   MONARCH OIL PIPELINE, LLC LAUNCHES NON-BINDING OPEN SEASON FOR NEW CRUDE OIL PIPELINE   Pipeline to Provide 30,000 bpd of Capacity from Production Areas in Texas to Reydon Station in Oklahoma   Monarch Oil Pipeline, LLC (Monarch), a subsidiary of Monarch Natural Gas Holdings, LLC, today launched an Open Season to solicit capacity commitments from shippers for a new crude oil pipeline system that will be constructed to gather and transport crude oil in interstate commerce from production areas in Hemphill and Lipscomb Counties, Texas (Production Areas) to Plains Pipeline, LP’s (Plains) Reydon Station located in Roger Mills County, Oklahoma, with the potential for expansion to other regional interconnects.   The new pipeline system will be divided into two primary components, an upstream gathering system to transport crude oil from the Production Areas to the Casey Station, an operational terminal and storage facility in Section 161 in Lipscomb County, Texas, and an 8‐inch mainline pipeline that will transport crude oil from the Casey Station to the Plains’ Reydon Station interconnect. Monarch projects an initial capacity of 30,000 barrels of crude oil per day on both components, but is open to negotiations to increase the pipeline capacity and/or alter its configuration to meet market needs.   The purpose of this Open Season is to solicit commitments from potential shippers who seek to transport crude oil gathered from the Production Areas to Plains on both of the two pipeline components (gathering and transportation), or only to transport crude oil from the Casey Station to Plains on the transportation component, and to solicit interest for additional pipeline transportation solutions in the region. Bidders making acreage dedications can request capacity and transportation rights on both pipeline components, or can request capacity and transportation rights on the transportation component only.   The Open Season will commence at 8:00 a.m. Central Time on December 1, 2014 and will end at 5:00p.m. Central Time on January 30, 2015.   For more information about the non-binding Open Season please send inquires to the following contacts:   Open Season Inquiries Contact:   Monarch Oil Pipeline, LLC2801 Via Fortuna, Ste. 675Austin, Texas 78746Attention: Mark IngramTelephone: (512) 215‐2194Email: mingram@mngllc.com  Media and General Inquiries Contact:   Mark Ingram512‐215‐2194mingram@mngllc.com  or   T.J. Henderson281‐814‐6909TJHenderson@mngllc.com  About Monarch Oil Pipeline, LLC:   Monarch is a subsidiary of Monarch Natural Gas Holdings, LLC (www.monarchnaturalgasllc.com), a private, full‐service midstream energy company focused on building and operating assets in the midstream sector of the Oil and Gas industries. Monarch Natural Gas Holdings, LLC provides producers of natural gas and crude oil with all related services from the wellhead to market by designing, building and operating facilities dedicated to the producers needs with a strong focus on performance, safety and reliability.   With significant equity funding from Metalmark Capital as well as management, Monarch Natural Gas Holdings, LLC has strong growth potential as we are able to move quickly to meet our customers’ needs while continuing to aggressively pursue new business development prospects through strategic acquisitions and greenfield projects.   Source: Business Wire (English), 12/01/2014Item: bizwire.c58866903

column10: Dublin - Research and Markets (http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/9xmrj3/analyzing_the) has announced the addition of the "Analyzing the Global Crude Oil Refining Industry 2015" report to their offering.The global refining capacity is expected to reach nearly 115,000 mbd by 2020. From 2014 onwards, Chinese refiners are expected to add a significant proportion of new refining capacity. Some of the largest crude oil refineries in the world include the Reliance Jamnagar Refinery in India, the Paraguana Refining Center in Venezuela, the Ulsan Refinery in South Korea, the Yeosu Refinery and the Onsan Refinery also in South Korea, the Port Arthur Refinery in the US, Exxon Mobil's Refinery in Singapore and its refinery in Baytown, Texas, US, etc.This research analyzes the global crude oil refining industry in this latest research offering Analyzing the Global Crude Oil Refining Industry. column5: SeawayCrudePipeline Company LLC, operated by Enterprise Products Partners L.P. (NYSE: EPD), today announced the loading of its first Very LargeCrudeCarrier (“VLCC”), which has the capacity of approximately 2 million barrels ofcrudeoil. The loading took place at the company’s marine terminal in Texas City, Texas June 22-24. The FPMC CMelody, chartered by Vitol, Inc., is the first VLCC to be loaded at a Texas port. The Texas City facility features two docks, a 45-foot draft, an overall length (LOA) of 1,125 feet, a 220-foot beam (width) and the capacity to loadcrudeoilat a rate of 35,000 barrels per hour.   [ABSTRACT FROM PUBLISHER]
column9: Seaway Loads First VLCC Ship
column10: Seaway Crude Pipeline Company LLC, operated by Enterprise Products Partners L.P. (NYSE: EPD), today announced the loading of its first Very Large Crude Carrier (“VLCC”), which has the capacity of approximately 2 million barrels of crude oil. The loading took place at the company’s marine terminal in Texas City, Texas June 22-24. The FPMC CMelody, chartered by Vitol, Inc., is the first VLCC to be loaded at a Texas port. The Texas City facility features two docks, a 45-foot draft, an overall length (LOA) of 1,125 feet, a 220-foot beam (width) and the capacity to load crude oil at a rate of 35,000 barrels per hour.   Approximately 1.1 million barrels of crude oil were loaded onto the FPMC C Melody at the Texas City marine terminal and the remainder of the crude oil shipment was loaded onto the VLCC in a lightering zone in the Gulf of Mexico.   “The loading of our first VLCC ship represents an important milestone for Seaway, as well as North American crude oil producers who benefit from greater efficiencies and cost savings,” said Brent Secrest, senior vice president, Liquid Hydrocarbons Marketing for Enterprise’s general partner. “Accommodating VLCC vessels reflects the midstream industry’s commitment to providing an integrated solution that supports continued development of growing domestic crude oil reserves, while enhancing market access and solidifying the Houston Ship Channel region as the premier location for exports.”   Seaway Crude Pipeline Company LLC is the owner of a pipeline system that transports crude oil from Cushing to the Gulf Coast, as well as a Gulf Coast distribution network, which serves local refineries and dock facilities at Freeport and Texas City, Texas. column5: DALLAS, Dec. 12, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- EnLink Midstream, LLC (NYSE: ENLC) (the General Partner) and EnLink Midstream Partners, LP (NYSE: ENLK) (the Master Limited Partnership) announced today that Robbie Leffel joined the company as Senior Vice President ofCrudeOilCommercial. Leffel is leading EnLink's commercialcrudeoilservices, working to significantly increase thecrudeoilsegment's contributions to EnLink's portfolio. [ABSTRACT FROM PUBLISHER]
column9: EnLink Midstream Names New Senior Vice President to Lead Commercial Crude Oil Business
column10: DALLAS, Dec. 12, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- EnLink Midstream, LLC (NYSE: ENLC) (the General Partner) and EnLink Midstream Partners, LP (NYSE: ENLK) (the Master Limited Partnership) announced today that Robbie Leffel joined the company as Senior Vice President of Crude Oil Commercial. Leffel is leading EnLink's commercial crude oil services, working to significantly increase the crude oil segment's contributions to EnLink's portfolio."Robbie is known in the industry for his deep crude oil expertise and leadership in commercial endeavors," said Barry E. Davis, EnLink Midstream Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. "His addition emphasizes EnLink's commitment to expanding our crude oil business. I look forward to seeing his team – and EnLink's crude oil business as a whole – continue to grow and succeed."Leffel has over 30 years of industry experience, specializing in crude oil. Most recently, he successfully managed his own consulting firm. Prior to that, he led the crude oil marketing and commercial functions for Enterprise Products, as the Senior Vice President Crude Oil. He also served in a marketing director role at Occidental Petroleum Corp. and spent a number of years at Amoco Oil Co. He received a Bachelor of Business Administration in Petroleum Land Management from Texas Tech University.About the EnLink Midstream Companies EnLink Midstream is publicly traded through two entities: EnLink Midstream, LLC (NYSE: ENLC), the publicly traded general partner entity, and EnLink Midstream Partners, LP (NYSE: ENLK), the master limited partnership entity. EnLink Midstream is a leading, integrated midstream company with a diverse geographic footprint and a strong financial foundation, delivering tailored customer solutions for sustainable growth.EnLink Midstream's assets are located in many of North America's premier oil and gas regions, including Oklahoma's Midcontinent, the Permian Basin, and the Gulf Coast region. Based in Dallas, Texas, EnLink Midstream's assets include approximately 11,000 miles of gathering and transportation pipelines, 21 processing plants with approximately 4.4 billion cubic feet per day of processing capacity, seven fractionators with approximately 260,000 barrels per day of fractionation capacity, as well as barge and rail terminals, product storage facilities, purchase and marketing capabilities, brine disposal wells, an extensive crude oil trucking fleet, and equity investments in certain private midstream companies.Additional information about the EnLink companies can be found at www.EnLink.com.Investor Contact: Kate Walsh, Vice President of Investor Relations, 214-721-9696, kate.walsh@enlink.comMedia Contact: Jill McMillan, Vice President of Public & Industry Affairs, 214-721-9271, jill.mcmillan@enlink.comTo view the original version on PR Newswire, visit:http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/enlink-midstream-names-new-senior-vice-president-to-lead-commercial-crude-oil-business-300376416.htmlSOURCE EnLink Midstream Source: PR Newswire US, 12/12/2016Item: 201612120804PR.NEWS.USPR.DA66256

Canadian Natural Resources Limited and Cenovus Energy Inc. will be the leading operators in terms of liquids production and number of the planned projects respectively.Scope- Annual breakdown of count and production of key planned Canadian oil sands projects from 2016 to 2025- Count and production of key planned Canadian oil sands projects by operators- Outlook of capital and operating expenditure for key planned Canadian oil sands projects for the period 2016 to 2025- Capital and operating expenditure for key planned Canadian oil sands projects by operators- Details of the major planned and announced Canadian oil sands projects up to 2025Reasons to buy- Obtain the most up to date information available on the planned Canadian oil sands projects- Identify growth segments and opportunities in the Canadian oil sands industry- Facilitate decision making on the basis of strong forecasts of planned oil sands projects data- Develop business strategies with the help of specific insights in to the planned Canadian oil sands projects- Keep abreast of the key planned Canadian oil sands projects- Assess your competitor's planned Canadian oil sands projects and productionRead the full report: http://www.reportlinker.com/p04519604-summary/view-report.htmlAbout Reportlinker ReportLinker is an award-winning market research solution.
